Uses of Class
de.uniheidelberg.cl.softpro.sentimentclassification.Instance

    • Uses of Instance in de.uniheidelberg.cl.softpro.sentimentclassification

      Methods in de.uniheidelberg.cl.softpro.sentimentclassification that return types with arguments of type Instance 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<Instance> CreateInstances.createInstancesFromFileNewFormat(java.io.File f)
      reads text file given in following format: category (tab) feature:count feature:count #label#:positive (new line) category .... and converts it into ArrayList of Instances with one Instance per review
      static java.util.ArrayList<Instance> CreateInstances.createInstancesFromString(java.lang.String s)
      reads string of reviews given in following format: feature:count feature:count #label#:positive<>feature:count .... and converts it into ArrayList of Instances with one Instance per review This format is only used for HadoopTrainPerceptronScalable.
      Methods in de.uniheidelberg.cl.softpro.sentimentclassification with parameters of type Instance 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean Perceptron.misclassified(Instance i)
      checks whether an instance is misclassified by trained Perceptron or not
      Method parameters in de.uniheidelberg.cl.softpro.sentimentclassification with type arguments of type Instance 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double Perceptron.test(java.util.ArrayList<Instance> testset)
      tests the SingleTaskPerceptron instance on a given test set
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> Perceptron.trainMulti(java.util.ArrayList<Instance> trainset, int currentEpoch)
      trains the Perceptron on a given set of instances, but only for one epoch
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> Perceptron.trainSingle(java.util.ArrayList<Instance> trainset)
      trains the SingleTaskPerceptron instance on a given training set for all epochs
